channel.title: [HELP] WEP protocols
channel.description:
Ok, i have been recently researching into WEP cracking and related tools. Obviously the most recommended OS is linux as it allows drivers to be installed for your wireless card which support 'monitor' mode.
Although i have a linux boot, i dont have Internet access on that pc (home) so cant get everything i need downloaded to try it out. Basically dont have internet access and cant get internet without internet access (if that makes ANY sense :P)
So, my questions, having XP as my only choice at the moment (7 more days until broadband is connected), i have been thinking about attempting basic brute forcing of WEP keys. I completely understand that this is the most long-winded aproach, but it was for experiance as much as anything.
Can anyone suggest a language and/or API which would access and send requests to the WEP/Wireless network? I mean to litterally brute force attempts. My only thought would be towards C/.NET but i have zero experiances with these languages or the resources relating to their usage
Any help or tips appreciated

Why brag about it if you can’t back anything up?

item.title: [HELP] WEP protocols
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

sup000:

Basically dont have internet access and cant get internet without internet access (if that makes ANY sense :P)

Happens to me all the time, since most versions of Linux dislike my older computer’s wireless adapter (Linksys) and it’s well beyond the range of my cat5 supply.

Airsnort has a Winows version.
I’m not sure what it offers, but here’s WinPcap.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] WEP protocols
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

i thought it had compatability issues with my belkin card (Broardcom 3xxx chipset) but i may have been wrong.

Taking another peak now, thanks. Any ideas still appreciated though, because i am interested still

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] WEP protocols
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Is there some reason you can’t run Airsnort on Windows?
You can do promiscuous mode on Windows too, y’know.

Read full topic
